title: The Lover
description: Jim and Pam return from their honeymoon and learn, to their horror, that Michael is dating Pam's mom. Meanwhile, Dwight gives Jim a "gift"--which actually has a listening device attached to it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: They're back!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oooh yeah... [people chuckle] Jim and Pam!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: How was Puerto Rico? Was it so romantic?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It really was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really was.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [voice cracks] I'm so happy for you...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Puerto Rico was awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh. The honeymoon was great. We met this other couple at the resort, Frank and Benny. We hung out with them a lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [goofy voice] Frank and Beans. [laughs] Always makes her laugh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [goofy voice] Frank and beans!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is there someone there? Who is there? I hear voices, is somebody there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is someone there? I can't see you because I'm blind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Its Jim and Pam, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gasps] It is?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're back? Oh! Oh! Oh, Pam! [reaching out with hands at chest level]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And oh, Jim...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I haven't see you since my accident that I had when I fell- I fell into the pool of acid, eyes first. Blind guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blind-guy McSqueezy. How do I describe it? It is a character I've been workshopping whose lack of vision gets him into all sorts of trouble. The women in my improve class absolutely hate him. [groans]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: So what'd you bring us?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Some candy.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What else?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, 'cause you spent so much on the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [behind Pam, acting out blind-guy, groaning]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's good to be home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This conversation has two items on the agenda.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do we have a conversation scheduled?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Number one, do not leave your things on my desk. It's not some kind of personal pen receptacle for you. I don't care how high they promote you, which brings me to item number two... I never formally congratulated you on your promotion, so I'd just like to say... [high voice, holding up wooden mallard] con-quack-ulations!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that's... really thoughtful of you, Dwight, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [duck voice] You're welcome! [quacks, laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I inserted a listening device into the belly of the mallard. Now I can observe Jim, trap Jim, and destroy Jim, just like in the Bavarian fairy tale. Only this time, the mallard skins the toad alive. And of course in this version you lose the whole veiled critique of the Kaiser thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry to have been bugging you all these years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's a real handsome duck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mallard. Okay, I'll get out of your hair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, we brought back some Puerto Rican candy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Coco Leche! That's my favorite!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Awesome! I'll leave it up here so everyone can enjoy it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, um, let me just check with Michael first.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] I think it'll be okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [laughs] I think it will too, but I'll just check with him, though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oops, sorry. [slides candy back to Pam] Oops.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have recently taken a lover.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that's great. Congratulations. Who's the lucky lady?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam's mom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam's mom, Helene. Remember from your wedding?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're messing with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: About what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You did not have sex with Pam's mom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, big time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What kind of car does she drive?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She drives a green camry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [expletive]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the seats go all the way down. All the way down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God. [Michael bangs the table] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, never tell Pam, and secondly-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, good, a pact. A pact. Although I may have to break it tonight when Helene and I tell Pam over dinner. You alright?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [walks in] Hey, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not now, Toby, my God!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, Jesus!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get the hell out of here, idiot.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What did I do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, as far as dinner tonight, cancel that, and please, for both our sakes, never, ever, ever see her again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you're underestimating Pam. I think more than anything, she wants me to be happy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not more than anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I have a good thing with the mom-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't call her "the mom."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's right on my way home from work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then take a different way home, man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I di- alright, I'll take surface streets, its- the last thing in the world I would want to do is upset Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so we're good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you change my dinner reservations from four people to two?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sure. Oh, is it okay if I put out some candy that Pam brought back from Puerto Rico?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure. Thanks for asking.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pam, we're all set. [Pam places candy on Erin's desk] Yum.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Frank and beans!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Frank and beans! [both laugh] So what'd we decide for Michael, the bottle of rum, or the seashell alarm clock?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Can I have the weekend to decide?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bottle of rum it is. [takes package out of bag] Alright, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what, I am really slammed, trying to catch up on everything here and I know that Michael's slammed too. So, maybe we should do this when things are a little less crazy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on, it'll take two seconds.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it- [high-pitched feedback as Jim starts to leave, feedback changes as he moves, turns over the mallard to see the listening devics, sighs, places mallard back on the desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [unwraps rum gift] Oh, wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is amazing. I feel like a real Puerto Rican.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael, you're all set at Botticelli's. I changed the reservation to two people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin, look. [holds up parrot rum bottle]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Fun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, Botticelli's, that sounds like a special occasion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, no, it's nobody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] I don't know. I think Michael has a date.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [chuckles] Hmm... no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] I think you have a date.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I think we should just drop it... 'cause obviously he doesn't want to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] I don't deserve this, guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, you do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just take the parrot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [long exhale]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, back to the old grind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was probably going to break up with her anyway.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, that's too bad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, it is very complicated. There are a lot of moving parts here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds complicated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but I mean, if you really like this person, then you should see where it goes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You want me to be happy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Part of the problem is, she is the mother of a close friend of mine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: More than a friend, a co-worker.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Gossip, who is it? Who is it? Who is it, Michael? ...Who?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no.  Oh, no. Oh, my God! Oh, my God! Nooooo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That could have gone one of two ways, but I never expected her to get upset.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [screams out in the parking lot, Michael watches from his office window]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Michael] You seem tense. Hey, you want me to give you the chills?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's an egg on your head and the yolk is running down, the yolk is running down...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Feels good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's a knife in your back and the blood is gushing down...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sleeping with Pam's mom. Sometimes, dinner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...the blood is gushing down, the blood is gushing down... You know, I really would have appreciated a heads-up that you were into dating mothers. I would have introduced you to mine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [outside, on cell phone] How could you do this to me? He's my boss! How many times have I complained about him to you? No, I am not being dramatic, you are being crazy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [singsong voice] Who wants a hot chocolate?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sighs] Oh, so Dwight gave me this wooden mallard as a gift, and I found a recording device in it. Yes. So, I think if I played it just right I can get Dwight to play out the plot of National Treasure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You need to be more upset about this. She's your mother too now. Your mother is sleeping with Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure thing, Tuna Boss.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [holding up a sign that reads, "Dwight picked the wrong day to put a wooden mallard in my office"]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in Jim's office] How may I be of service to you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am gonna need your advice [starts playing loud opera music, everyone can hear it, Creed starts crying] I was thinking about getting this opera for Dwight's birthday, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [both look at Dwight, Jim waves] This aurea is a joke.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was gonna go with this one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [both look at Dwight who is standing right outside the office] Let me tell you something, if you respect him at all, you will get him something better.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Andy gets up and leaves the office] The Nard Dog... what was that all about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What were you talking about in there?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Trust me it would only make you mad.  [opera continues, Dwight looks at Jim standing outside his office, waves, Jim waves back]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the conference room leading a meeting] Due to a certain recent incident, corporate has asked all the branches to come up with ideas as to how we can better communicate with our communities.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is this because of the 60 Minutes segment about working conditions in our Peruvian paper mill?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a hit job.  If you read the Dunder Mifflin press release it clearly states that they had absolutely nothing to do with that particular cancer cluster.  So if there is a lesson to be learned here and I'm not sure that there is, it is that in order to help our communities, we need to put other people's needs ahead of our own.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Haha!  Ha ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And whoever comes up with the best idea gets a $50 gift certificate to the restaurant of his or her choice.  [everyone claps and makes comments]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who wants to help the world one step at a time?  [Dwight raises his hand] Alright, good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Volunteerism is important.  Every weekend I volunteer at the local animal shelter and they need a lot of help down there.  Last Sunday I had to put down over 150 pets all by myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, that's...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Paint a mural of Chicano leaders.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have a way to make Scranton a better place, you could leave it.  [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I'm out of here, [pretends to leave] see you later guys...

quotes.speaker: Lauren's Friends
quotes.text: Get out and stay out, bye...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, oh no here's an idea... conservation...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love it, conservation.  Let's start by conserving our time and stop having these stupid meetings.   [stands up and cheers]  No more meetings!  No more meetings! No more meetings!  No more meetings!  [Stanley cheers her on in the background]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anybody else?  Who else has an idea?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have some ideas about conservation...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes!  Angela!  Please...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael leaves to answer his phone] Can you hold down the fort?   [on phone] Hey boo!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.  Sure well first of all I think that we could totally...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] What's it... why are you crying?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes!  I think we should look into that.  If you could just speak up louder...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] Shhhh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, for our profit...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] Shhh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] No, no, no, I'll talk to her.  I will... No... nobody talks to my baby that way... uh ah... yeah, I'll let you know how it goes.  Alright, by pickle.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Who's pickle?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hangs up phone and walks back into conference room] Pamela Morgan Beesly, you need to apologize to your mother right now.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm sorry, I was told I had the floor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hold on, hold on, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing... nothing at all... it's all good!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not apologizing to anyone.  Michael owes me an apology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For trying to find happiness in the arms of a lover?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't call my mother your lover.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!  That's what I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is not okay dude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, in my defense...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Disgusting...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: She's messed up man...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!  Thank you, welcome to my personal hell!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You have no sense of boundaries Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up Oscar.  Hey, alright, you know what, clearly I'm outnumbered here, but can I just say one thing, please?  What is so wrong about me?  I'm caring, I'm generous, I'm sensual.  Is it really so horrible that I could possibly go out and find happiness.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Good luck Michael, I hope you find what you're looking for.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe you're right, who are we to...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut up Oscar.  What is wrong with all of you, he is sleeping with my mother!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't think there's a whole lot of sleeping going on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's get back to the matter at hand.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whatever, you know, sleep with my mom, sleep with everybody's mom...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no... no, no...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoa, that's my mother you're talking about...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't like the tone here... this is a place of business, you are to listen to others, you are to give others respect, and you are to keep your personal issues out of it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhh, huh, ho... oooh my God, you are ridiculous!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do not talk to me that way!  I am your boss and I may someday be your father, so get out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You are never going to be my father, you get out!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hope that you are willing to die in this office, because I am...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Me too...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. [walks up to Oscar and hands him a report to sign]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [in a sing-songy voice] Pam, how's your day going?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, just for the record, I think you're overreacting a little bit, your mom's old enough to make her own decisions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, well, thanks Oscar.  I was just wondering how would you feel if Michael was sleeping with your mom?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My mother's in a wheelchair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, he could still... I'm sorry about that... Oh could I just get you to sign this second page.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [Dwight listening in his ear piece] Ryan, I have to ask you a personal question.   Do you think that I should get a Fedora?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ahh, I don't think so, no...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I think I'd look really hot in one.  Where'd you get your fedora?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd rather not say.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I think I'm gonna get the same fedora as you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight storms through the break room listening to Kelly and Ryan in his ear piece] Shh!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [Ryan and Kelly talking] ...it should go with the persona you already have.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I think I have that persona.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where did you get that mallard?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What the hell is a mallard?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, Professor Damien D. Duck, Jim gave him to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I gave that to him that as a gift, I'm taking that back.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If you take it back, I'll scream.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs heavily] I'll give you five bucks for it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Twenty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ten.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Deal. [pays Ryan and takes the mallard back]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Ryan] You're so cool.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This reminds me, you owe me three bucks for gas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks into Toby's office] Hey Toby, could I talk to you for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, sure, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, I just wanted to apologize for taking that tone with you earlier that was... uncalled for, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um, yeah, ah, ah, that means a lot.  Thank you for saying it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I sit down for a second?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, er... pull up a chair or sit on the shredder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is gonna sound weird, but I think I may be the victim of a hostile work environment with this whole Pam situation.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ah, you should probably deal with that outside of the work place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She brought it into the work place so I feel like it has to be dealt with here.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ok, I mean, I could talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?  Would you do that?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah... that's why they pay me the big bucks.  [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hugs Toby, who smiles big] You're a good, good guy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm good...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, I always knew if Michael just took the time to get to know me, we'd become friends.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [walks up to Pam's desk with a binder] Hey Pam, could I talk to you for a sec?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, I was hoping that maybe in light of everything that's happened today, it would be a good idea if today, you, me, and Michael could head into the conference room for some conflict resolution.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Michael] What's the matter, you can't fight your own battles?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... that's...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Maybe you could just take the rest of the day off... you know...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Michael] Oh, would that make you feel better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't... um... I can't hear your conversation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can tell Michael that I'm not leaving.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [gets up and puts a hand on Michael's shoulder] Buddy, I think that...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah-okay... you're a jackass.  [to Pam]  Hey, hey, you know what?  You're just as stubborn as your mother, when you don't wanna do something you just don't do it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Heh, heh, heh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, you're just her rebound!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You were right Jim, shoulda listened to you, should never have told her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] What!  You knew?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Barely, I... I don't have all the facts.  Frank and Bean...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam storms into break room] Okay, do you want me to stop seeing your mom?  Is that how we're gonna get past this?  Cause, I will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmmmm, yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that is not gonna happen!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then why'd you even offer!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I assumed that you want me to be happy because I want you to be happy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, let me make this very easy for you, I could give a sh[beep] about your happiness!  Stop dating my mother!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I'm gonna start dating her even harder.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's that supposed to mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what it means.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam storms out of the break room] Hey...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't need to be friends with Pam.  I have plenty of female friends.  My mom, Pam's mom, my aunt... although she just blocked me on IM, what's her face from Quiznos, I see her four times a week.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [walks into his office and sees the mallard back on his desk] Dwight, you brought the mallard back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I had to, I mean... Kelly was not even...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [speaking into the mallard and looking a Dwight] Hi buddy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walks into Jim's office and takes out ear piece] I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A wooden duck?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mallard.  I put it in your office in order to surveil you.  I was jealous that you got the promotion over me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, just to be clear, you're terrible at this and you are not equipped for espionage...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I'm equipped... I can...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Silence.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't tell Michael...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I won't.  But, you will wash and buff our car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Punishment fits the crime, I accept.  [shakes Jim's hand and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [leaving his office with his rum] Night everyone.  Night Pam, thanks again for the rum.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Night Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Night Erin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in the conference room] Hey Pam, can I see you for a second?  So, Dwight heard you were having a really rough day.  So he generously offered to wash our car.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking out the window at Dwight washing the car]  Awww, he did that for me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, he did.  You know what was nice, nights swimming in Bayou bay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael is seen debating on whether to come back in to the office] Remember that older couple whose kids were also named Jim and Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Haha, yeah.  Say more nice things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, we went on a Segway tour and we're awesome at it and Frank and Beans!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe I'm overreacting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah... maybe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But I don't think I am.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not, nope.  Nope.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Ryan is walking out of the office ahead of him] Oh... where'd you get that hat?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd rather not say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walks into Jims office, twists the top of the pen that he placed in Jim's pen holder which has a bug in it, pushes play] [Jim's voice] "We have our high quality 28 pound bond, our heavier 38 pound bond, or our..." [pauses recording] I've got eight hours of this.  Of course I wanted Jim to find the mallard, make him feel safe.  Did you really think I would put my primary listening device in a wooden mallard?  I'm not insane. [starts the recording again] "...65 pound cover stock, which is the heaviest paper that will still feed smoothly through your desktop printer."
